title: An Edinburgh eleven;
author: Barrie, J. M.
snippet: in Edinburgh. One Sunday when we were on our way up shishy Bath Street to Free St. George's he discovered that he had not a penny for the plate. I suggested to him to give twopence next time ; but no, he turned back to our lodgings for the penny.

title: Gone Again
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: Five minutes to park and get Nathan. He turned down Bath Street rather than Marlborough Street to save time, then met a Tesco van coming the other way and had to pull in. Come on, for Christ's sake.

title: Four years in the Old world;
author: Palmer, Phoebe
snippet: Many received pardon, and others were enabled to testify that the blood of Jesus cleansetli si'om all sin. Seldom have we witnessed such an extraordinary work in any place as has been going on during the past five weeks at the Unett and Bath Street chaj^els in this town. During our two-weeks' labor at Unett-street Chapel, three hundred and eighty gave in

title: Gone Again
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'That gets us an extra life,' Nathan shouted over the wind, as they tag-teamed on the large communal bin at the bottom of Bath Street.

title: Four years in the Old world;
author: Palmer, Phoebe
